catalogue_raissonne: Murase, Art through a Lifetime, no. 692
creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: glazed interior; dark olive, brown, and charcoal colored glaze with ochre, orange, and pink accented areas; 3 1/2" mouth diameter with slightly raised, rolled lip; several small bumps near mouth
medium: Tanba ware; stoneware with natural ash glaze
text: Honoho Tankyū was born and raised in the town of Tachikui, in Hyogo Prefecture, long a production area for Tamba ware--utilitarian vessels admired for their handsome dark brown coloration. The son of a potter, Honoho apprenticed with his father after graduating from high school in 1948. For the next twenty-seven years he labored in obscurity until first solo exhibition in 1975. His follows the Tamba tradition of leaving his wares unglazed, but he achieves a contemporary look through his distinctly modern shapes.
title: Vase
